Read the full release and letter here.
https://t.co/mqdaWbICZ9

We also asked for the previously approved hurricane recovery funding, included in the September government funding legislation, to be expedited as families continue to struggle across Louisiana – some still without housing, living in tents or lacking access to critical services.

3. Complementary hurricane protection, coastal restoration & flood control investments help to improve the safety & security of communities impacted by 2020 & 2021 hurricanes

We’re working to include additional investment in key Corps projects to prevent future hurricane damages

2. Hurricane Ida victims are yet to receive any of the $5 billion from the September 2021 law, the delegation seeks to increase disaster aid to comply with updated damage assessments from this powerful storm.

1. Provide additional funding to those affected by 2020 Hurricanes Laura, Delta and Zeta. In September, the delegation included $5 billion in disaster aid in response to 2020 and 2021 disasters. So far, $600 million has been allocated for those impacted by LA’s 2020 hurricanes.
LA’s Congressional Delegation has 3 main asks for this upcoming funding package:

Our efforts to deliver hurricane recovery funding for the citizens of south LA is already paying off but clearly there remains much work to be done. Gov. Edwards also recently indicated that for LA disasters alone, at least another $2.5 billion is required to recover.
Within one month of Hurricane Ida’s landfall, we were able to pass a law with billions of dollars in recovery funding and flood protection investments for Louisiana. https://t.co/8HsiqQucWt

Congress must pass an additional government funding bill on March 11, 2022, and we are calling for supplemental hurricane recovery funding to be included in that package
 
We need more hurricane relief for Laura, Delta, Zeta & Ida.

Thread on our recent efforts and upcoming asks: https://t.co/zJb7o30Ccp

Some Biden Admin energy policies since Feb. 7:

-FERC to increase bureaucratic red tape for pipeline construction
-Stonewalling LNG permits
-Considering tapping the SPR
-Facing pressure to use Iran’s oil over ours

Blocking US natural gas supplies will result in adverse outcomes. https://t.co/ZMgABuoGy6

America’s energy production is some of the most efficient in the world and our citizens have proven that we are the most innovative and hardest working.

Americans should be in charge of America’s energy future, not Iran or another country.
https://t.co/HDSNJRbgaX https://t.co/2llsex5jNO

This will undermine the security of Israel and the entire Middle East. Iran has been funding attacks against U.S. military, as well as men and women in Iraq, Syria and others. They also fund hostility in other countries.

Any deal with Iran needs to be strict and enforceable.

There will be a need soon for more oil on the global markets. We're concerned the Biden Admin is going to accept a bad deal with Iran & its nuclear ambitions to replace some of the lost energy supply

Why not produce more of our own American energy?

The Biden Admin can not cave https://t.co/eFgwa2bT2O

Gasoline prices, as well as electricity costs for all Americans, will surge – impacting American families’ pocketbooks in all 50 states. 

Continuing to block and obstruct a cohesive energy strategy undermines America’s leadership in this space.
https://t.co/k1M0x38hhB https://t.co/o1TMerepds

A predictable, adverse outcome?

There will be calls for, once again, tapping our Strategic Petroleum Reserves.

This bill puts the focus on delivering actual results for Louisiana – ensuring positive outcomes that protect our homes, businesses, communities, and livelihoods.
https://t.co/gYx9xpPNw1

FERC is clogging American pipes.

For those of you that have been begging for more red tape, more lawyers, more litigation, & more expensive prices at the pump & energy bills, your prayers have been answered.

https://t.co/6NU5dPaCqg

They continue to advocate for irresponsible policy then express shock when it creates an energy crisis.

Also Biden Admin: We are stonewalling LNG permits to block U.S. natural gas supplies from reaching the global market

Happy to accept your challenge. Didn't realize you were a girl scout. https://t.co/8BlazuBo7G

Rather than developing an exploration & production strategy that relies on America’s resources, lower emissions, affordable energy & creating economic opportunity, Democratic senators’ flawed policies open the door to expanded Russian influence & aggression & higher energy prices

We highlight the fact that the senators’ letter and continued advocacy to curtail domestic energy production clearly reveal hypocrisy and inexperience in energy security and global energy markets.
https://t.co/xBItRfSmbo

Our letter rebukes false claims of the senators who asked Granholm and the Biden Admin. to limit U.S. natural gas exports in an effort to ease rising domestic energy prices.
https://t.co/xBItRfSmbo

Ten senators asked DOE Sec. Granholm to “take swift action to limit US natural gas exports” & said shutting down U.S. LNG export facilities is “in the best interest of” their constituents

They advocate for irresponsible policy then express shock when it creates an energy crisis https://t.co/ESR8Z98MDX

As Gov. Edwards has previously said, we need at least another $2.5 billion to recover. 

The next announcement of funding specifically related to Hurricane Ida must be significantly more to adequately fix our homes, energy infrastructure, and communities.
https://t.co/Yv0CK4eRgv

$100 million to help prevent future hurricane, flood and other damages is headed to Louisiana.

We can either make investments to protect our citizens or we can spend millions more picking up the debris of destroyed homes and businesses.
https://t.co/Yv0CK4eRgv

This legislation puts the focus on delivering actual results for Louisiana, ensuring positive outcomes that protect our homes, businesses, communities, and livelihoods. (2/2)
https://t.co/rwBMorIbod

We introduced bipartisan legislation that would authorize billions in construction for several major hurricane protection projects and better protect our south Louisiana communities. (1/2) https://t.co/Xx0hySkgcx

More about the Upper Barataria Basin Project:
https://t.co/iWMj0wiJFf

We had major evacuation routes like U.S. Highway 90 going underwater even before Hurricane Ida made landfall. 

This is completely unacceptable. The Upper Barataria Basin Project will address this. https://t.co/vR9UYxREJA

Zero funding for Hurricane Ida or SW Louisiana recovery efforts in today’s government funding bill.

Yet, there are still folks living in tents and hotels. 

Electricity is just coming back in some of the communities. 

Roofs remain damaged in some places.
https://t.co/j1xcvLPdS6

The use of drones will keep advancing, innovating & supporting American jobs & improve our global competitiveness. 

But as we use advanced technologies to better support our nation’s infrastructure, it’s imperative that we do so in a way that protects national security. (2/2)

Introduced bipartisan legislation with @RepMoulton that would prohibit federal grants from being used to purchase drones that are manufactured and engineered by companies associated with the Chinese government. (1/2)
https://t.co/IEjIDmrkoV

This funding will provide $85.8 mil for new restoration projects & an additional $13 mil to develop new coastal solutions. The bill also funded the Coastwide Nutria Control Program, which pays licensed trappers a bounty of $6 per nutria tail during the trapping season. (2/2)

This legislation knocks out two rats with one trap. 

We’re directing millions toward coastal restoration efforts while funding the nutria police – both contributing to the same goal of protecting our state’s coast and people. (1/2)
https://t.co/FHi6KU9Gkt
We are pardoning Parish the Nutria from the nutria bounty program for choosing spring. https://t.co/xAUzH7G7fC

Rather than just making our homes worthless by charging unaffordable flood insurance rates, the solution is to build better protection and make our families safer. 

The Upper Barataria hurricane protection project does just that.
https://t.co/Zfq4LY5cB3

We're pushing U.S. Secretary of Commerce (DOC) Gina Raimondo to expedite “Fishery Disaster Determination” due to major damage related to impacts of Hurricanes Laura, Delta, Zeta and especially Ida.

Under law, only the DOC secretary can make this determination. (2/2) https://t.co/qzxvRGAr0n

Immediately after Hurricane Ida, we worked to secure $200 million in federal funding for fisheries disaster assistance. 

But this down payment can’t be made available for rebuilding our resources until a fisheries disaster has been determined. https://t.co/EHd1x6UkXw
(1/2) https://t.co/LcaoZn2K4q

This announcement comes after $8 million was secured recently for engineering and design of the Upper Barataria project. 

This will help to expedite implementation. (2/2)
https://t.co/leC790NhX6

We are committed to authorizing the Upper Barataria Basin Project for construction in federal law this year  

There is levee protection in nearby areas, but this project and funding address the Achilles’ heel in our vulnerability. (1/2)
https://t.co/a1qfyFDIja

We secured all the federal funding – including an additional $128 million secured recently to expedite Comite – and we will continue to hold the Corps and State’s feet to the fire on finishing the project without any more delays. 
https://t.co/WfXIz06bmS

The Corps has awarded a $17 million contract to construct the structure that will drain Cypress Bayou floodwaters into the new Comite Diversion Canal and then into the Mississippi River.

This is a big step forward, but we’re not done yet.
https://t.co/pQBjTHeocH

Within one month of Hurricane Ida making landfall, we were able to pass a law with billions of dollars in recovery funding and flood protection investments for Louisiana. 
https://t.co/zVv4vxlVzx

We secured $255 million to complete the Five Bayous and $343 million for the Comite Diversion – and we just added another $128 million to expedite completion of Comite. 

There is simply no more time to delay,
https://t.co/BkrZ47fSAW

Like Comite, there is persistent risk of missing construction deadlines on the Five Bayous Project. 

These projects together would have saved lives and billions in damages had they been in completed by the 2016 Flood and the 2021 Rain Bomb. (3/3)
https://t.co/5j6gCLM18D

Funding for both projects has been in place since 2018. 

We secured $255 million to complete the Five Bayous and $343 million for the Comite Diversion – and we just added another $128 million to expedite completion of Comite. 

There is simply no more time to delay. (2/3)

Like its companion – the Comite Diversion Flood Control Project – the East Baton Rouge Flood Control Project (also called the "Five Bayous" Project) has been around for decades and should have been completed already. (1/3) https://t.co/kWaqmkcKWz

Without the trapping, the nutria will continue to destroy native plants and burrow holes in our levees – remaining a large threat to our hurricane protection and coastal restoration efforts. (2/2)
https://t.co/ykTrqgdRzq

Legislation that would ban the use of traps in the National Wildlife Refuge System is being considered in the U.S. House, and we are working to prevent the legislation from harming our nutria eradication efforts. (1/2)
https://t.co/fWcJ3BcjuL

People have been talking about improving freshwater flows for decades, we are excited this next component is moving forward. (4/4)
https://t.co/B9LdRwMNhf

We’ve seen land loss and saltwater intrusion ever since. This project helps to improve the connection of the Mississippi River and the Lafourche basin — helping restore the health of the bayou and adjacent communities. (3/4)
https://t.co/B9LdRwMNhf

None of us were around in 1903 when they cut off the connection of the MS River to Bayou Lafourche, but we’re all paying for it now. The bayou was the largest distributary of the river and the primary source of freshwater and sediment for the region. (2/4)
https://t.co/B9LdRwMNhf

The Bayou Lafourche Mississippi River Re-Introduction and Pumping Capacity Improvement Project in Donaldsonville went out to bid for construction. 

This is another infrastructure win for south Louisiana. (1/4)
https://t.co/XFdI6OfQjH

https://t.co/JiK3Kq6Y3c

Great news today - billions of dollars in key hurricane protection, flood control, levee improvements and dredging are on the way.

Over 3/4 of this funding is coming from the hurricane recovery funding bill we passed in Sept. 2021 - within a month after Hurricane Ida landfall. https://t.co/G31lTOgSzy

More on these investments, our concerns, and where there remains work to be done. (6/6)
https://t.co/WfXIz06bmS https://t.co/cMURHd3j4q

https://t.co/cxCNtLOZ5N

We’ve had countless meetings, zooms, conference calls, and letters with the Corps and White House about the need to address Louisiana’s highest flood protection priorities. (4/6)
https://t.co/WfXIz06bmS

https://t.co/WfXIz06bmS

Within one month of Hurricane Ida making landfall, we were able to pass a law with billions of dollars in recovery funding and flood protection investments for Louisiana. (2/6)
https://t.co/ZGkV3eDfAV

Funded by Hurricane Ida recovery legislation, over $2.5 billion in new hurricane protection, flood control and other Louisiana projects make it on Corps' list.

A thread on efforts and funding, with more news to come: (1/6)

ICYMI - A Project Partnership Agreement (PPA) was signed today to advance the construction of Morganza-to-the-Gulf Hurricane Protection System. 

It outlines how federal, state and local entities will move forward on the construction of this critical hurricane protection project. https://t.co/O8W1eN5RcB

After decades with the federal gov. largely on the sidelines, today’s action brings the Corps of Engineers & their checkbook to the table. We’ve broken the federal logjam on this project, brought federal funds to the table, & will have more great news in the very near future.

Milestone reached for Morganza-to-the-Gulf Hurricane Protection system

While this may just look like a few signatures on a page, the bottom line is that today represents a new era on the project & safer communities in Terrebonne & Lafourche parishes.
https://t.co/9Vq39cMh7r
Great conversation today with Shalanda Young talking about hurricane protection, coastal restoration, flood control and dredging needs in Louisiana. https://t.co/s7XDyYHzQW

https://t.co/8tMM7bO1lu

A year ago today the DESCEND Act became law

When I came to Congress in 2015, there were only going to be 9 days to fish for red snapper in federal waters

In 2021? 143

Our efforts to force better science & management have resulted in more access to fishing in the Gulf of Mexico https://t.co/z4bpgV7HHX

Congress also passed billions in funding for projects tied directly to Hurricane Ida recovery such as debris removal, dredging the navigation channels, and building some of the resiliency projects. The funds have been in the bank for 104 days without allocation. (2/2)
